description.para: This data module documents a recurring deprecation warning in TIQâ€™s production environment caused by improperly formatted date strings passed into Moment.js, leading to unreliable parsing and logging.

fault.symptom: Console displays warning: "Deprecation warning: moment(...).format(...) is using a fallback for non-recognized date format \"04/05/2025\""
fault.cause: TIQ client-side code is passing ambiguous U.S.-formatted dates (MM/DD/YYYY) without ISO standard or explicit locale. Moment.js falls back to parsing heuristics, triggering warning and risking incorrect output.

remedy.step: Update all date parsing calls to explicitly use ISO 8601 or locale-aware formats (e.g., `moment('2025-04-05')`).
Wrap user-input dates with `moment.utc(...).local()` where timezone safety is required.
Refactor legacy date logic to newer libraries (e.g., Day.js, Luxon) with better validation support.
Suppress noisy warnings only after verifying the input is safe, not as a blanket rule.

para.code: Deprecation warning: value provided is not in a recognized RFC2822 or ISO format. moment construction falls back to JS Date(): 04/05/2025

remarks.para: Observed during April 6 midnight testing window. May interfere with token or expiration parsing logic during session refresh cycles if improper date formats lead to miscalculations.
